A database is a system that is most widely used in android is SQLite
SQLite requires a separate server to run on
QLite focuses on four commands- Select, Add, Update and Delete
The main package of an SQLite database is android.database.SQLite
The syntax of an SQLite database is as follows: SQLiteDatabase mydatabase = openOrCreateDatabase("your database name",MODE_PRIVATE,null);
To create a table or insert a table in the database you use the execSQL method
To fetch data within a database the getQuery() method is used to return the resultSet with the cursor pointing to the table
It is best to directly call the SQLite database from the activity code
Content providers act as a layer between the DB and the activity
Content providers manage access to a central repository of data

An advantage of a content provider is that it is a good abstraction layer between the data source and the UI code so it can add data validation, manage a structured set of data and modify how the data is stored
A content provider is NOT a blackbox that hides the underlying data in the UI
You can change the data source without changing the UI code when using content providers
Content providers are primarily intended to be used by other applications, which access the provider using a provider object
To access data in your content provider you use a content resolver object
The content resolver methods provide the basic CRUD (create, retrieve, update, delete) functions of persistent storage
A URI stands for a user resource identifier
A content resolver resolves the content within an application by providing resulting queries
An app talks to the resolver and calls the appropriate methods to the provider
